M(1) and M(2) are the centroids of the rings defined by C(1), C(2), P(1), P(2), P(3) and C(11), C(12), P(4), P(5), P(6), respectively.

Fig. 2 Solid state structure of 4. Selected bond distances (Å) and angles (°): M(1)–Sr–M(2) 146.73(6); Sr–M(1) 2.794(2), Sr–M(2) 2.791(2), P(1)–P(2) 2.1073(10), P(2)–C(2) 1.751(3), C(2)–P(3) 1.748(2), P(3)–C(1) 1.754(2), C(1)–P(1) 1.746(3), P(4)–P(5) 2.1101(9), P(5)–C(12) 1.748(2), C(12)–P(6) 1.755(2), P(6)–C(11) 1.750(2), C(11)–P(4) 1.749(2). M(1) and M(2) are the centroids of the rings defined by C(1), C(2), P(1), P(2), P(3) and C(11), C(12), P(4), P(5), respectively.

metadata.title: Synthesis and structural characterisation of the first hexaphosphastrontocene [Sr(η5-P3C2But2 )2] and its pyrazine adduct
